provide immediate assistance and instruction if needed.Provide Community Manager input regarding employee performance evaluationsEnsure effectiveness of staff through ongoing training, coaching, counseling, and guidance in compliance with Asset training benchmarksPromote harmony and quality job performance of staff through support and effective leadershipCustomer & Resident RelationsManage excellent customer service and monitor service request turnaround and responsivenessProjects a favorable image of the community to achieve property objectives and public recognitionEnsure consistency in dealing with residents on all mattersEnforce policies of the community that the immediate supervisor delegates

title: R&D Engineer - Power Electronics
description:
Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

As an R&D (Research and development) Engineer – Power Electronics, you will contribute significantly to technology and product development projects by identifying and implementing innovative solutions.

You will be responsible for the design and development of UPS (Uninterruptible Power Supplies) Products, that define and develop innovative power electronics solutions to fulfill customers’ requirements, within a multi-disciplinary team of electrical, mechanical, thermal and control experts.

This position reports to

Global R&D/Technology Manager

Your responsibilities

Design and develop power converters.Specify components and define technical requirements with suppliers.Support the overall design cycle of the new product, from simulation to validation and documentation, trough design and test.Conduct and coordinate complex analyses, develop recommendations based on technology/engineering practices and business considerations.Support operations and after sales organization during trouble shooting phases.Plan and coordinate a range of complex technology/engineering activities.

Your background

Master's in Electrical/Electronics Engineering with thesis in Power Electronics or Bachelors Degree in Electrical/Electronics with Power Electronics experience. 5+ years of UPS experience.Proven experience in power semiconductor characteristic, inductors and passive components.Experience with power electronic design topologies, knowledge of UPS technology and familiarity with the power protection.Knowledge of simulation tools (MATLAB/Simulink, LT Spice) and C programming language preferred.Good communication skills in English, both oral and written. Other languages are an asset.Significant experience in working within complex organization.Willingness to travel occasionally (5 percent). Candidates must already have a work authorization that would permit them to work for ABB in the US. 


Benefits

Retirement planLife insuranceDisability insuranceWellbeing programHealthcare plan

More about us

ABB Smart Power is a global technology leader, with products and solutions that make power supplies smart, connected and protected. Its intelligent products and solutions make power more competitive by improving the energy efficiency, productivity and reliability of almost any operation.

We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com.

title: Senior Software Product Manager (Open to Remote)
description:
Simpson Strong-Tie is a leader in engineered structural connectors, software, and solutions for the building industry. We maintain a reputation as a trusted manufacturer, partner, and corporate citizen committed to our customers and employees.

Our founder, Barc Simpson established 9 Principles of Business we live out as company values and have made Simpson Strong-Tie an inspiring place to work since 1956. Our team of talented people are dedicated to our shared mission: to provide solutions that help people design and build safer, stronger structures.

Learn About Our Company Culture Directly From Our Team.

YOU

The Senior Product Manager will collaboratively develop the product vision, prioritize initiatives, and effectively work with product teams to deliver value to our customers.

What You’ll Be Doing

Product Planning

Focusing on a set of applications within an assigned product portfolio, plan and prioritize the strategic roadmap on a regular basis to ensure product teams focus on items with maximum value, ensuring there are always an adequate number of prioritized initiatives and epics outlined in both the strategic roadmaps and product backlogs. (50%)

Guide Collaborative Product Efforts

Actively participate in regular agile development meetings including but not limited to the following. Product Increment meetings with stakeholders ensuring alignment of initiatives amongst product teams for reliable delivery. Pre-release meetings to review and share product increment with internal stakeholders. Product Backlog Refinement meetings with the product team prior to sprint planning to improve clarity of requirements of epics. Sprint Review meetings to review completed work with product team. Work with product marketing managers to ensure all marketing collateral and initiatives are successful. (20%)

Develop the Vision

Collaborate with business leadership teams, other Product Management team members and stakeholders to develop product strategy and vision. Constantly and clearly communicate that strategy and vision to the agile product team allowing them to best execute on the plan. (20%)

Leadership

Lead and motivate employees to provide best in class solutions for the product being created to best align their contribution towards the products impact on the overall organizational success by using effective leadership techniques, including establishing expectations and goals, providing recognition and feedback, and addressing performance problems. Foster a spirit of teamwork and unity among department members and the organization. (10%)

Desired Skills And Experience

If you can do everything listed above, you’ve got what it takes. Perhaps some of the following would be helpful too:


Experience with computer aided design software (CAD) or Computer aided design alternative software or BIM software required.2 years of leadership leading cross-functional teams required.Extensive experience with wood truss design and related software preferred.6 years of experience in product management or software product development preferred.Familiarity with software and machinery associated with the component manufacturing industry preferred.Vision: Must possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy; a big picture vision, and the drive to make that vision a reality.Communication: Ability to write in a clear, concise, organized, and convincing manner for the intended audience. Ability to effectively present information to groups of managers, team members and customers.Teamwork: Ability to build and sustain cooperative working relationships.Bachelor’s degree in computer science or technology, information systems or software engineering course of study or relevant experience required.Motivating Others: Ability to lead others in a positive and effective way that leads to high reward results.Organization: The ability to arrange resources to get things done; can orchestrate multiple activities at once to accomplish a goal; uses resources effectively and efficiently; arranges information and files in a useful manner.Problem Solving: Ability to identify the information needed to solve problems effectively.Composure: Ability to stay calm and in control in tense or frustrating situations.Customer Focus: Ability to cultivate relationships that secure commitment and trust with external and internal customer needs.Process Management: Ability to manage a repeatable process to improve the outcome of the product.Action Oriented: Ability to willingly take practical action to deal with a problem or situation in a timely manner.Perseverance: Ability to do something despite difficulty or delay in achieving success.Delegation: Ability to effectively entrust responsibilities to others.

title: ISSO GRC Risk Management Intelligence Lead
description:
We are creating an operationally effective and highly efficient “service of common concern” for all Integrity, Security, Support, and Operations (ISSO) Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) needs, ensuring Integrity, Security, Support, and Operations continue to meet global regulatory requirements and manage risk.Meta's ISSO GRC is the central engine driving risk management and compliance at the company, supporting Meta and the family of apps. We’re seeking deeply experienced, integrity and security leadership professionals to help enable and safeguard Meta’s products and services which have a truly global scale. ISSO GRC is simultaneously responsible for, (a) enabling the business to achieve its goals at scale and pace, (b) safeguarding the business against real world integrity and security risks, and (c) addressing the regulatory scrutiny the business faces. Our goal is to make Meta the premier place to work for governance, risk, compliance, security, and integrity professionals. The ISSO GRC Risk Management Intelligence Lead leads the risk intelligence program within the Risk Management subpillar for Meta’s ISSO risk domains. This role serves as a management leader in ISSO GRC, and leads the Risk Management Intelligence team within the broader ISSO GRC organization. This role ensures an effective and efficient Risk Management Intelligence program that complements the standards based risk management framework, to include standards based capability maturity and effectiveness, and risk quantification; transparently risk informs all business decisioning; enhances the centralized, comprehensive risk register based on one corporate tooling standard; and supports predicate-based risk assessments. This role serves as a strategic partner to a wide collection of cross-functional partners to include, but not limited to, business leaders, product and engineering leads, regional leadership, legal, corporate compliance, etc. in the implementation and execution of Meta’s risk domain programs. This role proactively drives alignment between business unit objectives and corporate strategy. As a business enabler, this role helps ensure the business is well risk managed, that business decisions adhere to corporate policies and are implemented with risks and risk signals as top of mind, while being mindful to the practicalities of speed, agility, and business results. Based on strategic risk domain needs, this role has strong influence over the delivery and priority of service features and development of new services and products, with a focus on continuous improvement of the risk domain culture, process, and technology.

ISSO GRC Risk Management Intelligence Lead Responsibilities:

Lead Risk Management Intelligence program within Risk Management subpillar of ISSO GRC for Meta’s ISSO risk domains.Serve as a management leader in ISSO GRC, and lead the relevant program teams within the broader ISSO GRC Risk Management organization.Develop, document, and operate a risk intelligence program, complementary to Meta Integrity, Information Security, and Integrated Risk Management, that accounts for risk quantification, standards (e.g., NIST CSF) based capability maturity and effectiveness and measurement and monitoring of controls effectiveness and broader risk signals.Support reporting with intelligence and insights into, and evidence of, emerging ISSO risks.Design, establishment, and tracking of KPIs and KRIs against risk appetite statements.Provide consideration, and guidance on regulatory matters and mitigate against uncertainty.Ensure adherence to defined standards in order for Meta to maintain legal and regulatory compliance.Support independent testing of Meta controls, and an Integrated Risk Management (IRM) Interface to improve the organizations risk posture.Identify risk domain specific risks and determine safeguards to reduce an incident’s probability of occurrence and impact.Establish a system of indicators for Meta to evaluate overall current risk at a glance for executive review and decision making.Facilitating effective risk domain management and evaluating Meta risk domain governance controls for Meta infrastructure that Meta relies on.

Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree in technical or business discipline or related experience.13+ years related experience with 7+ years in management or equivalent leadership roles with organization-wide impact.Demonstrated real world, hands on risk intelligence, risk management, and or business process design and implementation experience.Familiarity with integrity and security precepts, practices, and solutions.In depth knowledge of technology concepts, strategies and methodologies and their application to business opportunities.Advanced knowledge of management concepts, practices, and techniques.Strategy, vision, and direction development.Experience identifying gaps in strategy, systems, and processes to support growth at scale.Interpersonal skills with the experience to effectively influence others, goals, and strategy across the company.Experience to build collaborative working relationships with a broad range of global stakeholders.Familiarity with appropriate compliance frameworks and regulatory requirements (e.g., EECC, ePD, NISD, GDPR, NIST, DSA, OSA and other relevant anticipated integrity and security regulations), coupled with successful implementation of these to move a risk program forward.

Preferred Qualifications:

Direct experience leading GRC, or similar organizations.Responsibility of designing and managing risk intelligence functions, risk and control self-assessments, defining and tracking KPIs, risk quantification framework, exceptions process, as well as independent control testing, and standards compliance.Applicable U.S. national intelligence and national security experience.An Advanced Degree in technical or business discipline preferred.

About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.
